page.title: 10Block D1
page.content: An area of small farms,rough pastureland and moorland,rising to over 700 feet above sea_level.The area is disected by the B4306 road linking the area with Carmarthen via the village of Crwbin and Llangynderyn. In the bottom left_hand corner of the block stands Bancffosfelen Primary School which recently celebrated its centenary.Nearby is Capel Pisgah, one of the oldest chapels in the area. The area has a mixture of Private and Council housing.The majority of the private houses were built between the 2 World Wars.Both Council housing estates were built after the 2nd World War.Many of the council houses have,by now,been bought by the tenants.The area also houses the Bancffosfelen Welfare Hall used mainly for concerts and youth clubs.
